docs.title: Unofficial AsyncIO OpenAI API Client
docs.text:
Unofficial AsyncIO OpenAI API Client -> uaiooaiapic -> u9c

Currently a work in progress

u9c is an unofficial asynchronous OpenAI API client.

It also includes a command line interface (CLI) for utilizing the OpenAI API and some other utilities.

docs.title: As a Library
docs.text:
import asyncio

from u9c.client import OpenAiApiClient
from u9c.messages import ChatMessage, CreateChatCompletionRequest


OPENAI_API_KEY = "abc123"  # Insert your API key here.


async def main():
    async with OpenAiApiClient(OPENAI_API_KEY) as api_client:
        response = await api_client.send_request(
            CreateChatCompletionRequest(
                messages=[ChatMessage(role="user", content="Tell me a joke")],
                model="gpt-3.5-turbo",
            )
        )
    print(response)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    asyncio.run(main)

docs.title: On the CLI
docs.text: See u9c --help for details on CLI usage.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
For the moment u9c is only installable via source.

First git clone the repository:

$ git clone https://github.com/bnbalsamo/u9c.git

Then cd into the cloned repository:

$ cd u9c

Then use pip to install the package:

$ pip install .

Note

Remember to have your preferred virtual environment active before installing the package!

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text:
Contributions are welcome in the form of issues or pull requests.

See the instructions below for details on how to set up a development environment if you would like to contribute code.

docs.title: Setting Up a Development Environment
docs.text:
Git clone the repository:

$ git clone https://github.com/bnbalsamo/u9c.git

Then cd into the cloned repository:

$ cd u9c

Create and activate a virtual environment:

$ python3 -m venv venv

$ source venv/bin/activate

Install the development dependencies:

$ pip install -r dev-requirements.txt

Install the project in editable mode:

$ python -m pip install -e .

Confirm the package has been installed by printing the CLI help:

$ u9c --help

docs.title: API
docs.text: These docs are a little rough because most autodoc solutions appear to not play nicely with attrs classes - but this should give you the general idea.

docs.title: u9c.conversations
docs.text: Utilities for more easily interacting with chat completions in a chat-like way.

docs.title: u9c.conversations.ConversationHistory
docs.text:
Base class for persisting a conversation history.

This class doesn't persist the conversation history beyond its lifetime.

docs.title: u9c.conversations.ConversationHistory.add_message(msg) async
docs.text:
Add a message to the chat history.

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default msg ChatMessage

The message to add to the chat history

required

docs.title: u9c.conversations.JsonFileConversationHistory
docs.text:
Bases: ConversationHistory

Conversation history that uses JSON files on disk to persist conversations.

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default filepath Path

The filepath to load the conversation history from (if it exists) and write it to at the conclusion of the conversation.

required

docs.title: u9c.conversations.JsonFileConversationHistory.load() async
docs.text: Load the conversation history from disk.

docs.title: u9c.conversations.JsonFileConversationHistory.dump() async
docs.text: Write the conversation history to disk.

docs.title: u9c.conversations.Conversation
docs.text:
A conversation between a user and an AI.

Handles formatting ChatCompletionRequests and persisting to a conversation history automatically.

docs.title: u9c.conversations.Conversation.send_message(msg, model=None, user=None) async
docs.text: Send a user supplied message to an AI and return the response.

docs.title: u9c.misc.hash_username(hasher, username, salt=b'') cached
docs.text:
Hash a human readable username to produce a user identifier.

This user identifier is meant to be transmitted to the OpenAI API in place of a human readable username.

docs.title: u9c.api.client.OpenAiApiClient
docs.text:
A client for accessing the OpenAI API.

This class is an async context manager, and should be used as follows:

async with OpenAiApiClient(api_key, username) as api_client:
    response = await api_client.send_request(
        CreateChatCompletionRequest(
            messages=[ChatMessage(role="user", content="Tell me a joke")],
            model="gpt-3.5-turbo",
        )
    )
    print(response)

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default api_key str

The OpenAI API key to use to make requests by default.

required api_root str

The URL root for the API. Defaults to "https://api.openai.com/v1"

required

docs.title: u9c.api.client.OpenAiApiClient.send_request(req, session=None) async
docs.text: Send a request to the OpenAI API.

docs.title: u9c.api.messages
docs.text:
Wrapper classes for API requests and responses + their components.

These classes provide input validation as well as some added functionality for certain messages.

The role associated with the sender of the message.

docs.title: u9c.cli
docs.text: The u9c CLI.

docs.title: u9c.cli.KEY_ARG = click.option('-k', '--key', required=True, help='Your OpenAI API key.') module-attribute

u9c.cli.SIZE_ARG = click.option('-s', '--size', type=click.Choice(['small', 'medium', 'large'], case_sensitive=False), default='small', help='The size of image(s) to generate. Small=256x26, Medium=512x512, Large=1024x1024') module-attribute
u9c.cli.IMG_NUM_ARG = click.option('-n', '--number', default=1, type=click.IntRange(min=0, max=10), help='The number of images to generate.') module-attribute

u9c.cli.DL_LOC_ARG = click.option('-d', '--download-location', type=click.Path(exists=True, file_okay=False, dir_okay=True, path_type=Path, readable=True, writable=True), default=Path('.')) module-attribute
u9c.cli.u9c()
docs.text: The root parser for the u9c CLI. Select from subcommands below.

docs.title: u9c.cli.images()
docs.text: Subparser for image based functionalities. Select from subcommands below.

docs.title: u9c.cli.generate(key, username, number, size, download_location, prompt)
docs.text: Generate an image given a prompt.

docs.title: u9c.cli.variations(key, username, number, size, download_location, image_path)
docs.text: Generate variations of an image. The image must be a square PNG under 4MB

docs.title: u9c.cli.edits(key, username, number, size, download_location, image_path, mask_path, prompt)
docs.text:
Generate edits of an image. The image must be a square PNG under 4MB

The mask is an image whose fully transparent areas (e.g. where alpha is zero) indicate where image should be edited. Must be a valid PNG file, less than 4MB, and have the same dimensions as image.

docs.title: u9c.cli.completion(key, username, model, prompt)
docs.text: Create a Completion from a prompt

docs.title: u9c.cli.chat(key, username, model, message)
docs.text: Send a one-off message to ChatGPT and get a response.

docs.title: u9c.cli.conversation(key, username, model, conversation_history_file)
docs.text: Have a conversation with ChatGPT, saving history.

docs.title: u9c.cli.edit(key, username, model, input_, instruction)
docs.text: Send an edit request to ChatGPT and get a response.
